with the liquid from the bottle.

This is a scene from the 1967 film. Wait until dark. The scene as of suzy, who is played by audrey hepburn,
Susie runs down the stairs. Frantically.
She fumbles around for the telephone.
Concerned, she grabs the base of the phone and begins to shake it.

and discovers the court has been cut.
She grabs under the banister of the stairs, filling up the Top of the banister until she finds her cane
grabbing it. She grips the kinder chest as she stumbles across the room.

When she picks it up. To put it back on the table, she feels that the light had broken.

She begins to quickly go from light to light in her home and screwing and breaking the light bulb from each.
The home is now almost completely dark.
Susie walks across the room and turns on a light hanging from the ceiling.
She turns around, grabs a cord hanging down, and rips it off the wall.
She quickly runs back across the room to where she threw her cane down.

She ranks quickly back to the stairs, runs up them to her front door,
bills for the doorknob,
and throws the door open.

She runs into a room approach is a dress shirt and takes a large bottle off the Top.
She walks into the living room and screwing the cap of the bottle as she goes.
She places down on a table next to a base with flowers in it. She picks up the bass and pours the water on the ground.

The camera cuts to the bottle, which reads the word typo on chemical.

audio_descriptions.notes:
This is a scene from the 1967 film Wait Until Dark. The scene is of Susy, who is played by Audrey Hepburn
Susy runs down the stairs frantically
She stops when she feels the edge of the couch with her hands
She fumbles around, stopping when she finds the telephone
She spins the dial, and places the receiver to her ear
Growing concerned, she grabs the base of the phone and begins to shake it
With no answer, she places the phone down and begins to feel around
She finds the phone cord, running the cord through her hands she reaches the end, discovers the cord has been cut
Feeling the end of the cord, she begins to panic
Distraught, she grabs on to the banister of the stairs, feeling up to the top of the banister until she finds her cane
Grabbing it, she grips the cane to her chest as she stumbles across the room
She throws the cane down in anger where it lands on a small table, knocking a lamp onto the ground
Susy feels for the lamp that fell. When she picks it up to put it back on the table she feels that the light had broken
Her expression turns into one of determination
She drops the lamp, and quickly walks over to the kitchen
She feels for the light above the sink and pulls out the bulb, dropping it in the sink
She begins to quickly go from light to light in her home, unscrewing and breaking the lightbulb from each
The home is now almost completely dark
Susy walks across the room, turns on a light hanging from the ceiling
She turns around, grabs a cord hanging down, rips it off the wall
She quickly runs across the room back to where she threw her cane down
She drops to her hands and knees, frantically feeling around the floor
She finds her cane, grabs it, stands up
She runs quickly back to the stairs, runs up them to her front door, feels for the doorknob, throws the door open
She runs into the hallway, towards the door of her building
She extends the cane towards the ceiling, finds a light, hits it with the cane to break it
She turns around, begins to run down the hall, waving the cane back and forth in the air
It hits and breaks another light
She runs back inside the apartment, quickly shuts the door
She runs into the room, approaches a dresser, takes a large bottle off of the top
She walks to the living room, unscrewing the cap of the bottle as she goes
She places it down on a table next to a vase with flowers in it
She picks up the vase and pours the water on the ground
She feels for the bottle, finding it, picks it up, pours the contents into the vase
Places the vase and the bottle back on the table
The camera cuts to the bottle, which reads the words “hypo” and “chemical”

result.title: Best Horror Scenes: Wait Until Dark (1967)
result.description:
"Best Horror Scenes" is a collection of scenes I feel are some of the most affecting in horror. Some may be simple black cat scares, others may be more subdued or nuanced. Many come from films that aren't necessarily "horror" but have elements or threads of horror, and all have the same general effect: unease, dread, fear, shock, or disgust.

If you have recommendations for scenes to include please feel free to suggest via comments or by contacting me!

* Obvious footnote: Clips may contain spoilers!
